result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Nicholas M. Gruning in court.  Attorney Francis R. Lettenberger in court for Nicholas M. Gruning.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Offer just received. Minutes filed.
File destruction date scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court

Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Nicholas M. Gruning in court.  Attorney Francis R. Lettenberger in court for Nicholas M. Gruning. Not guilty plea entered by counsel and trial reserved.  Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on August 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Nicholas M. Gruning in court. Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Complaint filed in court. Defendant will attain Atty. Defendant is requesting 30 days. No objection for the State. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed bond filed with the court.
Notice to Person Posting Bond Money

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH B.G. OR RESIDENCE. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant. 

22-3077 thru 3080

Case called at 1:37 PM. Defendant Nicholas M Gruning in court, in custody by video. Samuel Berg for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Grace Hagerman for bond purposes only. Defendant does not qualify for SPD. Record by State as to bond. Response by Attorney Hagerman. Victim is not present. $1000 cash bond set. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
